Detailed Description

The MobileOriginatedUssdHandler is a SS handler responsible for handling and conducting mobile-originated USSD transactions.
The class provides methods to initiate UUSD transaction, parse the data provided by the mobile network and forward that data as messages.
After the transaction has started the mobile network might reply with UUSD notifies and replies as well. The superclass's methods can be used to react to such messages.
See also:
SsMainHandler

SsDispatcher

MoUssdHandlerId

SsBaseHandler::ReturnCode MobileOriginatedUssdHandler::ProcessStackMsgArgument (  const SsStackMsgArgument &  arg  )  [virtual]
 

This method is called by the SsDispatcher upon receiving a StackMsgArgument. The method checks whether the given argument is processable in any way (contains correct data), creates a new message object using the appropriate Create*Msg methods and stores the message by means of its superclass.

Parameters:
arg The wrapper object which should contain either a SsUnstructIndArg or a SsUssdResentIndArg to be processed.
Returns:
OkMessageReady - if a message was created,
TipdMismatch - if the tipd of the argument does not match the tipd of the current transaction,
OperationCodeMismatch - if the argument's operation code does not match the expected operation code associated with the initial request,
UnexpectedArgument - if the argument is not either a SsUnstructIndArg or a SsUssdResentIndArg,
or any other code the Create*Msg methods might return.
See also:
SsBaseHandler

SsDispatcher

Reimplemented from UssdHandler.

void MobileOriginatedUssdHandler::RegisterTransaction (  Tipd  tipd  )  [virtual]
 

Overloaded method of SsBaseHandler::RegisterTransaction to add sending of a UssdRequestResentMsg when a transaction is registered after Ussd resent.

Parameters:
tipd The tipd of the transaction after Ussd resent.

SsApiRc MobileOriginatedUssdHandler::SendUssdRequest (  const WString &  ss_ctrl_sequence,
const DataCodingScheme &  dcs,
BOOLEAN  register_only = FALSE
) 
 

Sends a new UUSD request to the mobile network.
This method sends a new UUSD request to the mobile network using the main handler.
If there is no transaction currently active a new transaction will be established. Otherwise the request will be sent as part of the current transaction.

Parameters:
ss_ctrl_sequence The control sequence containing the request and its data.
dcs The data coding scheme for the request.
register_only A flag that indicates if the request is sent to the GSM stack or only registered at SsMainHandler.
Returns:
Any value SsMainHandler::EndTransaction might return, or any other value SsMainHandler::PostArgument might return.

SsApiRc MobileOriginatedUssdHandler::TerminateUssdTransaction (  Tipd  tipd  ) 
 

Terminates the given transaction.
The given transaction (which is the current one since multiple concurrent transactions are not supported) is terminated using the main handler. All stored parameters are reset during the process.

Parameters:
tipd The tipd of the current transaction (not used).
Returns:
Any value SsMainHandler::EndTransaction might return.
See also:
SsMainHandler
